results.title: Decreasing inappropriate behaviours (TEFC): timeout
results.creator_credit: John Sucho and Macomb Community College Instructional Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Effective Behavioural Programming”.
Tape 4 : Timeout is a procedure in which positive reinforcement is withdrawn for a prespecified period of time following the performance of a misbehaviour. There are two types of timeout: exclusionary and non-exclusionary timeout. NB. This tape plays on 525 line NTSC
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Sucho and Macomb Community College Instructional Television

results.title: Decreasing inappropriate behaviours (TEFC): reinforcement procedure
results.creator_credit: John Socha and Macomb Community College Instructional Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Effective Behavioural Programming”.
Tape 4 : Discusses procedures for decreasing inappropriate behaviours within the least restrictive model of treatment. This model ranks the procedures according to their evasiveness, severity, and intrusiveness. When decreasing inappropriate behaviours, the teacher should only move to the next procedure if the current procedure is ineffective. NB. This videotape plays on 525 line NTSC
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Socha and Macomb Community College Instructional Television

results.title: Structuring the learning environment (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Effective Behavioural Programming”.
Discusses four key points concerning the learning environment for severely and profoundly retarded students: the normalisation model; a ten point plan for increasing behaviour; the reasons why inappropriate behaviours occur; handling disruptive students

results.title: Discovering reinforcers (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: John Socha and Macomb Community College Instructional Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Effective Behavioural Programming”.
Tape 1 : The use of reinforcers in the classroom is the key to motivating students. Reinforcers are events that follow a response and increase the probability that the response will occur again. Retarded people have fewer reinforcers. It is important for a teacher to discover appropriate reinforcers for the particular class NB. This tape is on 525 line NTSC.

results.title: Gourmet Fish Cooking
results.brief_description: This excellent video provides viewers with an easy to follow step by step guide to gourmet fish cooking. International chef, Peter Jarmer, passes on the tricks of the trade in selecting and filleting fish, cooking techniques and the art of exquisite presentation. Rated: G

results.title: Gossamer Albatross: flight of imagination
results.creator_credit: Joseph Thompson and Thompson Horton Associates
results.brief_description: Tells the story of Dr Paul MacCready’s and Bryan Allen’s attempt to design and fly a man-powered aircraft over the English Channel. Narrated by Hal Holbrook.

results.title: Goodbye Lynn
results.brief_description: Tells the story of Lynn, a teenager, unwed and pregnant, and the problems she faces with her family, school friends, teachers, doctors and her boyfriend. Focuses on the interpersonal relationships and emotional stresses that affected the girl.

results.title: Good soldier Swejk
results.creator_credit: Jiri Trnka and Czechoslovak State Film
results.brief_description:
Featuring Czech puppet animation, this film consists of three episodes in the life of a Swejk - a solider famous in Czech folklore for his awkward ways and clashes with authority. A satire on militarism, “Good Soldier Swejk” is a sly critique of army life depicted with puppets, which were Czech animator Jiri Trnka’s speciality. Swekj has a talent for unsettling his superiors, showing them up for the inept militarists that they are, whilst remaining blissfully unaware of his misdeeds. Episode one: Swejk is sent to buy a black market bottle of cognac for his superior. When he is caught by another officer he is forced to pretend the cognac is water and drink the whole bottle in one go. Episode 2: Swejk takes a train journey with his superior and earns his wrath for rambling on endlessly with various stories that upset those around him. Swejk is arrested when he decides to pull the emergency brake in order to determine that it works. Episode 3: Having misplaced his regiment, Swejk is arrested on suspicion of being a Russian spy whereupon a top criminologist interrogates him. Several officers guarding him proceed to get drunk and sentimental about the fate of their prisoner before escorting him to the courthouse.

Credits: Director, writer, Jiri Trnka ; photography, E. Franek ; music, Vaclav Trojan; editing, H. Lebduskova ; animation, B. Sramek , B. Pojar, J. Karpas.

results.title: Good housekeeping: for men only
results.brief_description: A safety film for employees in the building industry. Shows how to increase efficiency and reduce accidents by proper use and storage of materials and by taking proper precautions in the course of the building activities.
